b'When I was a young-er writer, I was at a small dinner with Martin Amis. A writer\xe2\x80\x99s name came up and Martin said, casually, \xe2\x80\x9cwell, he\xe2\x80\x99s a sloppy writer.\xe2\x80\x9d I said, \xe2\x80\x9cWhat makes a sloppy writer?\xe2\x80\x9d He said, \xe2\x80\x9cUnintended alliteration, accidental rhyme, repetition of words.\xe2\x80\x9d'
